data.message: This one was on its way to the ocean, before I picked it up in Belper recently. Time to step up to the mark, Coca Cola, and either bring back the old bottle deposit system, or move to 100% recyclable plastic.

replies.message: Hi Roger, for the last five years we’ve been using 25% recycled plastic across all our brands, a figure we want to increase to 50% by 2020, but there’s not enough recycled plastic to go beyond that in Great Britain at the moment. This is why as part of our strategy we will be seeking reform of the recycling system in the UK to improve recovery and recycling rates. We’re looking into how a well-designed deposit-return scheme (DRS) could work in Great Britain. The introduction of these schemes is complex and ultimately is a decision that must be led by Government, requiring many organisations, public and private to work together. We want any planned deposit-return scheme to be well-designed, making sure it has the biggest impact on litter and the lowest impact on kerbside collection and have been working with stakeholders in Scotland to understand the best approach.
